sense.name: command against or prohibit something
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[human]] FORBID NP2[patient[animate]] (PP{P NP[predicate]}) NP1[agent[human]] FORBID NP2[patient[inanimate]] NOTE: [human] also includes collectives of human entities such as commitees, church, lawmakers etc.
sense.examples: The church forbade the bishops from giving the emperors the title 'holy.' Marcus Aurelius forbade the condemnation of criminals to be gladiators. Italy forbids the sale of soft drinks in elementary schools.

sense.name: hinder or make impossible
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[abstract]] FORBID NP2[patient[animate]] (PP{P NP[predicate]}) NP1[agent[abstract]] FORBID NP2[patient[inanimate]]
sense.examples: Justice absolutely forbade the killing of anything that had life. Canon 7 forbids the exaction of a sum of money for the burial of the dead.
